oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-12-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 12, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys (including Howdy Forrester, June Webb, Bashful Brother Oswald, Jimmy Riddle, and Shot Jackson), guest performers Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, and Minnie Pearl. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1053rd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Archie Campbell; Bill Carlisle; Carlisles; Tommy Jackson; Howdy Forrester; Jimmie Selph; June Webb; Jimmy Riddle; Pap's Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Roy Acuff, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Grant Turner and Roy Acuff introduce Bill Carlisle -- Union Suit (My Grandpa Was A Confederate) (Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Grant Turner introduces Tommy Jackson and Howdy Forrester -- Snowflake Breakdown (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Howdy Forrester, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Roy Acuff introduces June Webb -- What A Price To Pay (June Webb) -- Grant Turner and Roy Acuff introduce Jimmy Riddle and the Jug Band -- Rag Mop (Jimmy Riddle harmonica, Pap's Jug Band)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Jackson, Tommy; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Webb, June, 1934-; Bashful Brother Oswald; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Jackson, Shot; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Carlisle, Bill; Carlisles (Musical group)
